page.title: 09THE NEW HOSPITAL COMPLEX
page.content:
I live in the Monks Road area and my back garden overlooks the new County Hospital complex. The original site of the hospital, built in 1769, was on Waterside South, moving to the present site on Sewell Road in 1876. The development of Phase I (east of the present hospital) commenced in 1981 at a cost of Â£16.7 million. It was opened on the 23rd July 1985 by the Princess of Wales. There are two blocks, two stories high consisting of four wards, four operating theatres and various departments in one block, and the out- patients department in the other. There are 625 rooms, 30 miles of pipe work, 2000 miles of electric cable in this wing. In all, 3 phases are planned, with completion due in the 1990's.
Sarah Pedge Age 13.
